security: Revealing the existence of backstopping facilities and the process by which expenses are handled could compromise intelligence operations and agent identities. The memo explicitly requests that "backstopping facilities be provided for Subject by the following organization" and details the submission of expenses via a post office box, which could expose methods used to conceal financial transactions related to covert activities.
summary: A memo from Horace W. Davis to the Chief of the Cover Division requests backstopping facilities for Henry P. Lopes through Ashmond, Twiford Associates and outlines procedures for expense submissions.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated October 27, 1959, from Horace W. Davis, Acting Chief of the Political Action Division, is addressed to the Chief of the Cover Division, specifically Mr. Strange, regarding Henry P. Lopes. It requests the provision of backstopping facilities for Lopes through Ashmond, Twiford Associates in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, detailing that Lopes will send a copy of his expenses to this organization while submitting a detailed accounting to FI/FIG via a post office box. The memo also includes Lopes' address in Los Angeles, California, and notes that his passbook is forwarded separately.
title: Henry P. Lopes
sender: Horace W. Davis, Acting Chief Political Action Division
